poem:
**Hallstatt Reverie**  

In a village where whispers of snowflakes  
dance with stories of ice,  
a world peeks from behind the tourist veil.  
Mustafa's gaze softens the air—  
a lens captures what the heart dares;  
not the throngs, but the quiet breath  
of a tale woven in frost-laden silence,  
where dreams learn to fly.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It really felt like I was in a fairytale’: Mustafa Seven’s best phone picture Mustafa Seven and his friend Hazem were attempting to escape the tourists in an Austrian village when they took this image. Rumoured to have inspired Disney’s Frozen franchise, Hallstatt has been known to attract up to 10,000 visitors a day during high season. Seven had seen many Instagram shots of the place and was curious to visit. He was taken aback". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
